Home → Parents, carers and children → The Princess and the Christmas Rescue, by Caryl Hart & Sarah Warburton

The Princess and the Christmas Rescue, by Caryl Hart & Sarah Warburton

Written by Sophie Green · Published Dec 7, 2017

Every day until Christmas Eve, stock librarian Sophie will recommend one of our brilliant new Christmas books for children. Today’s book is The Princess and the Christmas Rescue, by Caryl Hart & Sarah Warburton.

“Princess Eliza is awfully lonely in her beautiful snow palace. Stuck inside all day with no-one to play with, she’s become brilliant at building her own toys. Eliza can make anything with a few bits of wood and some string! Anything, that is, except the thing she wants most: a friend!”

Sophie Green

I work for the Suffolk Libraries stock team. I also write children’s fiction, short stories and comedy. Visit my website.

More Children's books

  • Pick up a great story for 6-8 year-olds from the inaugural Alligator's Mouth Award shortlist
  • Oulton Broad Library choose: Diary of a Wimpy Kid, by Jeff Kinney
  • Glemsford Library choose: The 13-Storey Treehouse, by Andy Griffiths & Terry Denton
  • Debenham Library choose: Gangsta Granny, by David Walliams & Tony Ross
  • Stradbroke Library choose: Rabbit's Nap, by Julia Donaldson & Axel Scheffler
  • Southwold Library choose: Oi Frog!, by Kes Gray & Jim Field
  • Beccles Library choose: The Amber Spyglass, by Philip Pullman
  • New children's books for May 2019
  • Borrow a brilliant children's poetry book from the 2019 CLiPPA shortlist
  • Stowmarket Library choose: Stig of the Dump, by Clive King & Edward Ardizzone
